Description: Upon receipt of a No-Op command, CS shall increment the CS Valid Command Counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Debug command to verify application is alive.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Reset command, CS shall reset the following housekeeping variables to a value of zero:
a)       Valid Ground Command Counter
b)       Ground Command Rejected Counter
c)       Non-volatile CRC Miscompare Counter
d)       OS Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter
e)       cFE Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter
f)        Application CRC Miscompare Counter
g)       Table CRC Miscompare Counter
h)       User-defined Memory CRC Miscompare Counter
i)         Checksum Pass Counter (number of passes through all of the checksum areas)
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Important for testing and on-orbit flight operations in order to start with a “clean slate”.

Description: For all CS commands, if the length contained in the message header is not equal to the expected length, CS shall reject the command and issue an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Basic command verification in the event of SEU or memory corruption

Description: If CS accepts any command as valid, CS shall execute the command, increment the CS Valid Command Counter and issue an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operators require feedback on command execution

Description: If CS rejects any command, CS shall abort the command execution, increment the CS Command Rejected Counter and issue an error event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operators require feedback on command execution

Description: CS shall use the <MISSION_DEFINED> CRC algorithm to compute the CRCs for any segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide the flexibility for a mission to define the CRC algorithm that is used.

Description:
The Checksum App shall calculate CRCs for each Table-Defined Non-volatile segment and compare them against the corresponding baseline Non-volatile segment CRCs if:
a)       Checksumming (as a whole) is Enabled
b)       Non-volatile segment checksumming is Enabled
c)       Checksumming for the individual Non-volatile segment is Enabled
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to verify Non-volatile memory. Note that each segment within a non-volatile region can have a different size since the segment is defined as an address and number of bytes

Description: If the Non-volatile segment CRC is not equal to the corresponding baseline CRC, CS shall increment the Non-volatile CRC Miscompare Counter and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Since the location of files loaded to Nonvolatile is unknown apriori, there is no way to determine which Nonvolatile segment or segments will be affected

Description: If the table-defined segement is invalid, CS shall send an error event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of invalid segment processing

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Non-volatile Checksumming command, CS shall enable non-volatile checksumming
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of all of the nonvolatile memory segments defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Non-volatile Checksumming command, CS shall disable non-volatile checksumming
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of all of the nonvolatile memory segments defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Non-volatile Segment command, CS shall enable checksumming of the command-specified non-volatile segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of a particular segment

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Non-volatile Segment command, CS shall disable checksumming of the command-specified non-volatile segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of a particular segment

Description:
Upon receipt of a Recompute Non-volatile Checksum Segment command, CS shall:
a) Recompute the baseline checksum for the command-specified non-volatile segment
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Would be used after non-volatile memory is updated in order to regenerate the baseline

Description: If CS is already processing a Recompute CRC command or a One Shot CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Recompute is done in a background task so can only do one recompute at a time

Description:
Once the baseline CRC is computed, CS shall:
a) Generate an informational event message containing the baseline CRC
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of baseline CRC computation completion

Description: Upon receipt of a Report Non-volatile Checksum Segment command, CS shall send an event message containing the baseline checksum for the command-specified non-volatile segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ground with the baseline being used.

Description: Upon receipt of a Get Non-volatile Checksum Segment command, CS shall send an event message containing the segment number for the command-specified non-volatile address
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ground with ability to map the address to segment. Helpful since other commands use segment ID.

Description: If a command-specified segment is invalid (for any of the non-volatile memory commands where segment is a command argument), CS shall reject the command and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to handle the case where an invalid segment is specified for any of the nonvolatile commands

Description: CS shall provide the ability to dump the baseline CRCs and status for the non-volatile memory segments via a dump-only table
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need the ability to get all of the non-volatile checksums. Easiest to use the cFE Table services dump-only table feature

Description:
Checksum shall calculate CRC for the OS code segment and compare them against the corresponding baseline OS code segment CRC if:
a)       Checksumming (as a whole) is Enabled
b)       OS segment checksumming is Enabled
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to verify the OS code segment

Description: If the OS code segment CRC is not equal to the baseline OS code segment CRC, CS shall increment the OS Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of CRC mismatch.

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable OS code segment command, CS shall enable checksumming of the OS Code segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of the OS code segment

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable OS code segment command, CS shall Disable checksumming of the OS Code segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of the OS code segment

Description:
Upon receipt of a Recompute OS code segment CRC command, CS shall:
a) Recompute the baseline CRC for the OS code segment
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): May want to recompute OS code segment in the event of a modification to the  OS code segment

Description:
Once the baseline CRC is computed, CS shall:
a) Generate an event message containing the baseline CRC
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Gives the ground indication not only that the CRC baseline was calculated but what the value is.

Description: If CS is already processing a Recompute CRC command or a One Shot CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Recompute done in the background so can only do one at a time

Description: Upon receipt of a Report OS code segment CRC command, CS shall send an event message containing the baseline OS code segment CRC.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ability to view the OS code segment baseline CRC

Description:
Checksum shall calculate CRC for the cFE code segment and compare them against the corresponding baseline cFE code segment CRC if:
a)       Checksumming (as a whole) is Enabled
b)       cFE segment checksumming is Enabled
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to verify the cFE code segment

Description: If the cFE code segment CRC is not equal to the baseline cFE code segment CRC, CS shall increment the cFE Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of CRC mismatch

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable cFE code segment command, CS shall enable checksumming of the cFE Code segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of the cFE code segment

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable cFE code segment command, CS shall Disable checksumming of the cFE Code segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of the cFE code segment

Description:
Upon receipt of a Recompute cFE Code Segment CRC command, CS shall:
a) Recompute the baseline CRC for the cFE Code Segment
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): May want to recompute cFE code segment in the event of a modification to the cFE code segment

Description:
Once the baseline CRC is computed, CS shall:
a) Generate an event message containing the baseline CRC
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Gives the ground indication not only that the CRC baseline was calculated but what the value is

Description: If CS is already processing a Recompute CRC command or a One Shot CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Only able to process one recompute one at a time

Description: Upon receipt of a Report cFE code segment CRC command, CS shall send an event message containing the baseline cFE code segment CRC.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ability to view the cFE code segment baseline CRC

Description:
Checksum shall calculate CRCs for each Table-Defined Application's code segment and compare them against the corresponding Application's baseline code segment CRC if:
a)       Checksumming (as a whole) is Enabled
b)       App code segment checksumming is Enabled
c)       Checksumming of the individual Application Code Segment is Enabled
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to verify each Application’s code segment. Note that CS depends on ES to provide the information as to which applications are running

Description: If the Application's code segment CRC is not equal to the corresponding  Application's baseline code segment CRC, CS shall increment the Application Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter and send an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): In practice, when a new application is being loaded, checksumming of Application code segments should be disabled prior to the load and then enabled after the load.

Description: If the table-defined Application code segment is invalid, CS shall send an event message and skip that Application code segment.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This may be a result of an invalid Application code segment table or a deleted application.

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Application checksumming command, CS shall enable checksumming of all Application Code segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of all of the Application code segments defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Application checksumming command, CS shall Disable checksumming of all Application Code segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of all of the Application code segments defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Application code segment command, CS shall enable checksumming of the command-specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of a particular Application code segment

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Application code segment command, CS shall Disable checksumming of the command-specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of a particular Application Code segment. This may be particularly useful when reloading an existing application.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Recompute Application Code Segment CRC command, CS shall:
a) Recompute the baseline CRC for the Application
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Would be used after an Application code segment is updated in order to regenerate the baseline

Description:
Once the baseline CRC is computed, CS shall:
a) Generate an event message containing the baseline CRC
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Gives the ground indication not only that the CRC baseline was calculated but what the value is.

Description: If CS is already processing a Recompute CRC command or a One Shot CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can only support one recompute CRC at a time

Description: Upon receipt of a Report Application code segment CRC command, CS shall send an event message containing the baseline Application code segment CRC
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ground with the baseline being used.

Description: If the command-specified Application is invalid (for any Application Code Segment command where the Application is a command argument, CS shall reject the command and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to handle the case where an invalid Application is specified for any of the Application code segment commands

Description: CS shall provide the ability to dump the baseline CRCs and status for the Application code segment memory segments via a dump-only table
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need the ability to get all of the application code segment checksums. Easiest to use the cFE Table services dump-only table feature

Description:
Checksum shall calculate CRCs for each Table-Defined Table and compare them against the corresponding Table's baseline CRC if:
a)       Checksumming (as a whole) is Enabled
b)       Table checksumming is Enabled
c)       Checksumming of the Individual Table is Enabled
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to verify each Table CRC . Note that CS depends on ES to provide the information as to which Tables to checksum

Description: If the Table's  CRC is not equal to the corresponding Table's baseline CRC and the table has not been modified (thru a table load), CS shall increment the Table CRC Miscompare Counter and send an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): cFE Tables services provides an indication that a table was modified, a checksum miscompare when a table was not modified via a table load, then there was a checksum failure

Description: If the Table's CRC is not equal to the corresponding  Table's baseline CRC and the table has been modified (thru a table load), CS shall recompute the table baseline CRC.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If a table is changed via a table load, CS needs to recompute the baseline CRC

Description: If the table-defined Table  is invalid, CS shall send an event message and skip that Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This may be a result of an invalid Table table or a deleted table.

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Table Checksumming command, CS shall enable checksumming of all Tables.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of all of the Tables defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Table Checksumming command, CS shall Disable checksumming of all Tables.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of all of the Tables defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Table Name command, CS shall enable checksumming of the command-specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides control over enable/disable status of each table

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Table Name command, CS shall Disable checksumming of the command-specified Table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides control over enable/disable status of each table

Description:
Upon receipt of a Recompute Table CRC Command, CS shall:
a) Recompute the baseline CRC for the command-specified table
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If a table is modified, CS needs to recompute a baseline CRC

Description:
Once the baseline CRC is computed, CS shall:
a) Generate an event message containing the baseline CRC
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Gives the ground indication not only that the CRC baseline was calculated but what the value is.

Description: If CS is already processing a Recompute CRC command or a One Shot CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can only support one recompute at a time

Description: Upon receipt of a Report Table CRC command, CS shall send an event message containing the baseline Table CRC for the command-specified table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ground with the baseline being used.

Description: If the command-specified Table in invalid (for any CS Table command where a table name is a command argument ), CS shall reject the command and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to handle the case where an invalid Table is specified

Description: CS shall provide the ability to dump the baseline CRCs and status for the tables via a dump-only table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need the ability to get all of the table checksums. Easiest to use the cFE Table services dump-only table feature

Description:
Checksum shall calculate CRCs for each Table-Defined User-Defined Memory and compare them against the corresponding  baseline CRC if
a)       Checksumming (as a whole) is Enabled
b)       User-Defined Memory checksumming is Enabled
c)       Checksumming of the Individual Memory segments is Enabled
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to verify each Table CRC. Note that CS depends on ES to provide the information as to which Tables to checksum

Description: If the User-Defined Memory's CRC is not equal to the corresponding  baseline CRC, CS shall increment the User-Defined Memory CRC Miscompare Counter and send an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Inform operator of CRC mismatches

Description: If the table-defined Memory is invalid, CS shall send an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This may be a result of an invalid User-Defined Memory area

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable User-Defined Memory Checksumming command, CS shall enable checksumming of all User-Defined Memory.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Enable checksumming of all of the User-Defined Memory defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable User-Defined Memory Checksumming command, CS shall disable checksumming of all User-Defined Memory.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Disable checksumming of all of the User-Defined Memory defined in the table

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable User-Defined Memory Item command, CS shall enable checksumming of the command-specified Memory.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational control of checksumming command-specified memory

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable User-Defined Memory Item command, CS shall Disable checksumming of the command-specified Memory.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational control of checksumming command specified memory

Description:
Upon receipt of a Recompute User-Defined Memory CRC command, CS shall:
a) Recompute the baseline CRC for the command-specified User-Defined Memory.
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allows continued CRC checking for areas of memory that are intentionally changed.

Description:
Once the baseline CRC is computed, CS shall:
a) Generate an event message containing the baseline CRC
b) Set the Recompute In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Gives the ground indication not only that the CRC baseline was calculated but what the value is.

Description: If CS is already processing a Recompute CRC command or a One Shot CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can only support one recompute at a time

Description: Upon receipt of a Report User-Defined Memory CRC command, CS shall send an event message containing the baseline CRC for the command-specified User-Defined Memory.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the ground with the baseline being used.

Description: If the command-specified User-Defined Memory is invalid (for any of the User-Defined memory commands where the memory ID is a command argument), CS shall reject the command and send an event message
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to handle the case where an invalid User-Defined Memory is specified

Description: CS shall provide the ability to dump the baseline CRCs and status for all the User-Defined Memory via a dump-only table.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need the ability to get all of the User-Defined Memory checksums. Easiest to use the cFE User-Defined Memory services dump-only User-Defined Memory feature

Description: Upon receipt of a Get User-Defined Memory Entry ID command, CS shall send an informational event message containing the User-Defined Memory Table Entry ID for the command-specified Memory Address.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational support for getting memory table entry ID

Description: If the command-specified Memory Address cannot be found within the User-Defined Memory Table, CS shall send an informational event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of memory address not found

Description: The CS software shall limit the amount of bytes processed during each of its execution cycles to a maximum of <PLATFORM_DEFINED> bytes
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to make sure that CS does not hog the CPU

Description: Upon receipt of a Enable Checksum command, CS shall start calculating CRCs and compare them against the baseline CRCs.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides global control over CS

Description: Upon receipt of a Disable Checksum command, CS shall stop calculating  CRCs and comparing them against the baseline CRCs.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides global control over CS. Note that this supercedes the enable/disable status of each region’s enable/disable status AND the enable status of each element within a region (eg. Even if App code segment X is Enabled, CS will not perform checksumming operation. If Table checksumming is Enabled, CS will not perform checksumming.

Description:
Upon receipt of a One Shot command, CS shall:
a) Calculate the CRC starting at the command-specified address for the command-specified bytes at the command-specified rate (Max Bytes Per Cycle).
b) Set the One Shot In Progress Flag to TRUE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides a generic capability to compute a checksum for any memory

Description:
Once the CRC is computed CS shall:
a) Issue an event message containing the CRC
b) Set the One Shot In Progress Flag to FALSE
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of CRC computation completion

Description: If CS is already processing a One Shot CRC command or a Recompute CRC command, CS shall reject the command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can only process one One Shot command at a time

Description: If the command-specified rate is zero, CS shall calculate the CRC at the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> rate (Max Bytes Per Cycle).
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Use default CRC calculation rate if not specified in command

Description: Upon receipt of a Cancel One Shot command, CS shall stop the current One Shot calculation.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): In the event that a memory region is too large, requiring too much time, cancelling the calculation may be required

Description:
CS shall generate a housekeeping message containing the following:
a)       Valid Ground Command Counter
b)       Ground Command Rejected Counter
c)       Overall CRC enable/disable status
d)       Total Non-volatile Baseline CRC
e)       OS code segment Baseline CRC
f)        cFE code segment Baseline CRC
g)       Non-volatile CRC Miscompare Counter
h)       OS Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter
i)         cFE Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter
j)         Application CRC Miscompare Counter
k)       Table CRC Miscompare Counter
l)         User-Defined Memory CRC Miscompare Counter
m)      Last One Shot Address
n)       Last One Shot Size
o)       Last One Shot Checksum
p)       Checksum Pass Counter (number of passes thru all of the checksum areas)
q)       Current Checksum Region (Non-volatile, OS code segment, cFE code segment etc)
r)        Non-volatile CRC enable/disable status
s)       OS Code Segment CRC enable/disable status
t)        cFE Code Segment CRC enable/disable status
u)       Application CRC enable/disable status
v)       Table CRC enable/disable status
w)      User-Defined Memory CRC enable/disable status
x)      Last One Shot Rate
y)      Recompute In Progress Flag
z)      One Shot In Progress Flag
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Housekeeping telemetry to indicate basic CS status.

Description:
Upon any Initialization of the CS Application (cFE Power On, cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset),  CS shall initialize the following data to Zero:
a)       Valid Ground Command Counter
b)       Ground Command Rejected Counter
c)       Non-volatile CRC Miscompare Counter
d)       OS Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter
e)       cFE Code Segment CRC Miscompare Counter
f)        Application CRC Miscompare Counter
g)       Table CRC Miscompare Counter
h)       User-Defined Memory CRC Miscompare Counter
i)       Recompute In Progress Flag
j)       One Shot In Progress Flag
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): No information is preserved across a cFE Processor reset or CS Application Reset.

Description:
Upon a cFE Power On Reset, if the segment's <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power-On Initialization state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the following regions:
a)       OS code segment
b)       cFE code segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to compute a baseline which is used to compare against when background checking the checksums.

Description: Upon a cFE Power On Reset, if the Non-Volatile <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power-On Initialization state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for Non-volatile segments based on the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to compute a baseline which is used to compare against when background checking the checksums.

Description: If the address range for any of the Non-volatile segments is Invalid, CS shall send an event message and disable Non-volatile Checksumming
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table validation includes verifying that the memory ranges are within limits

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Non-volatile Checksumming, if the state is not one of the following:
a)       enabled
b)       disabled
c)       empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table validation includes verifying that the table contains valid intial states.

Description: Upon a cFE Power On Reset, if the Non-Volatile <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power-On Initialization state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute the baseline CRC for the total of all of non-volatile segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to have a checksum for the entire image. Note that the CRCs for each of the non-volatile segments specified in the table are added together to arrive at this number.

Description: Upon a cFE Power On Reset, if the Application <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power-On Initialization state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the Application code segments region based on the corresponding table definition for up to a <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Applications
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to compute baselines for the Applications specified in the table. The platform-defined value could be equal to the max number of apps defined by cFE ES but could be less

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Application code segment Checksumming, if the state is not one of the following:
a)       enabled
b)       disabled
c)       empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table validation includes verifying that the table contains valid initial states.

Description: Upon a cFE Power On Reset, if the Tables <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power-On Initialization state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the tables specified in the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> tables
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A table is used to define the tables that should be checksummed. Baseline checksums are computed for the tables specified in the table. The platform-defined value could be equal to the max tables defined by cFE TBL but could be less

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Table Checksumming, if the state is not one of the following:
a)       enabled
b)       disabled
c)       empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table validation includes verifying that the table contains valid initial states.

Description: Upon a cFE Power On Reset, if the User-Defined Memory <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power-On Initialization state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the User-Defined memory region based on the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> memory segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to calculate baseline for all User-defined memory segments specified in a table

Description: If the address range for any of the User-Defined Memory is Invalid, CS shall send an event message and disable User-Defined Memory Checksumming
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table validation includes verifying that the memory ranges are within limits

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Checksumming of the User-Defined Memory, if the state is not one of the following:
a) enabled
b) disabled
c) empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Table validation includes verifying that the table contains valid initial states.

Description:
Upon a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True, CS shall preserve the following:
a) OS Code Segment Checksumming State
b) cFE Code Segment Checksumming State
c) Non-volatile Checksumming State
d) Application Code Segment Checksumming State
e) Table Checksumming State
f) User-Defined Memory Checksumming State
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET flag is true

Description: Upon a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to False, CS shall perform initialization in accordance with a Power On reset.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET is false

Description:
Upon a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True and the segment's state is set to Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the following regions:
a)       OS code segment
b)       cFE code segment
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Baseline recompute reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET is true

Description: Upon a Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True and the Non-volatile Checksumming State is Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for Non-volatile segments based on the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Baseline recompute reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET flag is True.

Description:
If the address range for any of the Non-volatile segments is Invalid, CS shall send an event message and disable Non-volatile
Checksumming
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational notification of invalid address range for non-volatile segment

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Non-volatile Checksumming, if the state is not one of the following:
a) enabled
b) disabled
c) empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Response to invalid state request

Description: Upon a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True and the Non-volatile Checksumming State is Enabled, CS shall compute the baseline CRC for the total of all of non-volatile segments
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Checksum recompute reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET is True

Description: Upon a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True and the Application Code Segment Checksumming State is Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the Application code segments region based on the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Applications
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Checksum recompute reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET is True

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Application code segment Checksumming, if the state is not one of the
following:
a) enabled
b) disabled
c) empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Response to invalid state request

Description: Upon a a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True and the Table Checksumming State is Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the tables specified in the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> tables
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Checksum recompute reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET flag is True

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Table Checksumming, if the state is not one of the following:
a) enabled
b) disabled
c) empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Response to invalid state request

Description: Upon a cFE Processor Reset or CS Application Reset, if the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET Flag is set to True and the User-Defined Memory Checksumming State is Enabled, CS shall compute baseline CRCs for the User-Defined memory region based on the corresponding table definition for up to <PLATFORM_DEFINED> memory segments.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Checksum recompute reset behavior when PRESERVE_STATES_ON_PROCESSOR_RESET is True

Description: If the address range for any of the User-Defined Memory is Invalid, CS shall send an event message and disable User-Defined Memory Checksumming
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Operational response to user-defined memory invalid address range

Description:
CS shall send an event message and disable Checksumming of the User-Defined Memory, if the state is not one of
the following:
a) enabled
b) disabled
c) empty
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Response to invalid state request
